title: Tools-related courses - GIT, Markdown, Vim, Latex, JetBrains
description: A lot of tools that you might use such as GIT, Unity, VIM, Doxygen, and Docker. We are also including languages such as Markdown, Latex, and ReStructuredText.

~e1.name: Docker
~e1.desc: What's docker and how you could use it to run applications everywhere.

~e1.name: Git
~e1.desc: Git is the most famous version control tool, and as a programmer, you must learn it.

~e1.name: VIM
~e1.desc: The legendary, old yet powerful console terminal editor.

~e1.name: Markdown
~e1.desc: The most used language to write documentation or to write beautiful documents without needing a lot of knowledge or a complicated syntax.

~e1.name: RST
~e1.desc: A language to write documentations outside your code with a lot of powerful tools such as generating UML, graphs ... The syntax is like an improved version of Markdown.

~e1.name: LaTeX
~e1.desc: A language used to write reports, create presentations quite easily and with great style. You may also use it to write math in a website/documents.

~e1.name: Doxygen
~e1.desc: Write standardized documentation in your projects. You can generate a website, like with the Javadoc in Java.

~e1.name: Powershell
~e1.desc: This is a program abstracting .Net (Common Language Runtime (CLR)), allowing us to run commands called cmdlets.

~e1.name: Inno Setup
~e1.desc: A tool to create Windows installers, with an uninstaller and a modern interface.

~e1.name: Data languages
~e1.desc: A gathering of notes about easy to learn, and easy to master, data languages, such as JSON (and JSON5), or YAML.

~e1.name: Toolbox
~e1.desc: A lot of notes about a lot of things that can't be added to another course.

JetBrains.name: JetBrains
JetBrains.desc: Make your programming life easier by coding inside powerful preconfigured IDEs.
